label: ZEN24
description: Z-Wave Plus On/Off Toggle Dimmer v3

1.label: Switch behavior
1.description: Determines whether up is on and down is off; or up is off, down is on

4.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer Time
4.description: Time after which the switch automatically turns off

6.label: Auto Turn-On Timer Time
6.description: Set the time after which the switch automatically turns on

9.label: Ramp Rate Control
9.description: Adjust the physical ramp rate for your dimmer (fade-in / fade-out effect for on / off operation).

10.label: Minimum Brightness
10.description: Set the minimum brightness level (in %) for your dimmer. You won’t be able to dim the light below the set value.

11.label: Maximum Brightness
11.description: Set the maximum brightness level (in %) for your dimmer. You won’t be able to add brightness to the light beyond the set value. Note: if Parameter 12 is set to value 0, Parameter 11 is automatically disabled.

12.label: Double Tap Function
12.description: Choose if you want the dimmer to turn on to full brightness or custom brightness level after you toggle the switch up twice quickly.

13.label: Scene Control Enable
13.description: Enable or disable scene control functionality for quick double tap triggers.

14.label: Double & Single Tap Enable
14.description: Enable or disable the double tap function and assign brightness level to single tap.

options.label: Double Tap Disabled, Single Tap to Last Brightness
Double Tap Disabled, Single Tap to Full Brightness

15.label: Local Toggle Control
15.description: Enable or disable manual on/off control. If enabled, you’ll only be able to control the connected light via Z-Wave. Scenes and other functionality will still be available through the physical switch.

options.label: Physical switch and Z-Wave control disabled

16.label: Physical Dimming Speed
16.description: Set the time it takes to get from 0% to 100% brightness when pressing and holding the toggle.

17.label: Z-Wave Ramp Rate Control
17.description: Choose if you want to set the Z-Wave ramp rate independently of the physical ramp rate (using an appropriate command in your hub) or if you want them to match.

18.label: Custom Brightness On
18.description: Set the custom brightness level (instead of the last set brightness level) you want the dimmer to come on to when you toggle the switch up once. 0 Means last brightness level.

19.label: 3-Way Switch Type
19.description: Choose the type of 3-way switch you want to use with this dimmer in a 3-way set-up. Changing this setting can allow you to control brightness and dim the light from both 3-way locations. Use a regular momentary switch (like the Zooz ZAC99 accessory switch) if value is set to 2. See Zooz website for details.

20.label: Report for Holding PhysicalToggle
20.description: Choose how you'd like the dimmer to report when the toggle is held and physical / Z-Wave control is enabled or disabled.

21.label: Report status when toggle is disabled
21.description: Report light status when both physical and Z-Wave control are disabled.

22.label: Night Light Mode
22.description: Set the brightness level the dimmer will turn on to when off and when lower toggle is held DOWN for a second. 0 Means feature is disabled.
